physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 13-year-old male presented with a 2â€“3 month history of right hip pain, fever, rigors, night sweats, weight loss, and intermittent chest pain. Radiologic studies revealed multiple nodules in the lungs, abscesses in the spleen, and lytic lesions in the right occiput, right ilium, and distal right femur.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Evidence of infection resolved over the next several months after treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Father of patient 1 (patient 2) had multifocal osteomyelitis due to NTM infection with a 2-month history of fever, night sweats, ankle pain, and weight loss. Radiologic studies found lytic lesions in the distal right ulna and radius, right index finger, left distal femur, and proximal tibia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 2 responded well to treatment but later developed osteomyelitis of the ribs and thoracic vertebrae.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Paternal uncle of patient 1 (patient 3) presented at 13 months of age with prolonged fever and diffuse lymphadenopathy. Radiologic evaluation revealed destructive lesions in multiple bones.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: With treatment, patient 3 improved but had recurring symptoms upon withdrawal of therapy.
